required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study to Investigate the PK, Efficacy, and Safety of Wilate in Patients With Severe Hemophilia A
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study to Investigate the Pharmacokinetics, Efficacy, Safety, and Immunogenicity of Wilate in Previously Treated Patients With Severe Hemophilia A

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to obtain additional data on the safety and efficacy of Wilate in PTPs with hemophilia A with at least 150 previous exposure days (EDs) to a FVIII concentrate who undergo prophylactic treatment with Wilate for 6 months and at least 50 EDs, thus supplementing the existing database to obtain approval of Wilate for the indication hemophilia A in the USA.

primary_outcome.measure: Reduction of total annualized bleeding rate
primary_outcome.description: 50% reduction of the total annualized bleeding rate (TABR) observed in the GENA-01 study, with a total of 58.1 BEs per patient per year.

secondary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of Wilate in the treatment of breakthrough BEs based on the proportion of BEs successfully treated with Wilate
Wilate consumption data (FVIII IU/kg per week per patient) for prophylaxis
PK assessment (Area under of curve) of FVIII:C using the one-stage (OS) assays and actual IMP potencies
PK assessment (In vivo half life) of FVIII:C using the one-stage (OS) assays and actual IMP potencies
PK assessment (Maximum plasma concentration (Cmax))) of FVIII:C using the one-stage (OS) assays and actual IMP potencies
Incremental IVR of Wilate over time (at baseline, and at 3 and 6 months of treatment)
Association between ABO blood type and the FVIII:C half-life of Wilate
Association between VWF:Ag concentration and the FVIII:C half-life of Wilate
Safety and tolerability of Wilate by monitoring adverse events (AEs) throughout the study
Immunogenicity of Wilate by testing for FVIII inhibitors
Virus safety to be measured by the number of incidence of parvovirus B19 seroconversions between baseline and end of study

other_outcome.measure: Efficacy of Wilate in surgical prophylaxis assessed by surgeon and hematologist using predefined assessment criteria

arm_group.description: All patients will receive Wilate for prophylactic treatment

intervention.other_name: von Willebrand factor / Factor VIII (plasma derived)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Severe hemophilia A (<1% FVIII:C) according to medical history
2. Male patients aged ≥12 years
3. Previous treatment with a FVIII concentrate for at least 150 exposure days (EDs)
4. Immunocompetence (CD4+ count >200/µL)
5. Good documentation of the historical bleeding rate (at least for the 6 months preceding study start)
6. Voluntarily given, fully informed written and signed consent obtained by the patient (or parent/legal guardian in case of adolescents) before any study-related procedures are conducted
Whenever possible, the interval between the Screening Visit and the PK or Non-PK Visit should not exceed 30 days. If the 30-day interval is exceeded, determination of the CD4+ count is to be repeated and must be >200/µL for patients to be enrolled (i.e., exclusion criterion no. 4).
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Any coagulation disorders other than hemophilia A
2. History of FVIII inhibitor activity (≥0.6 BU) or detectable FVIII inhibitory anti-bodies (≥0.6 BU using the Nijmegen modification of the Bethesda assay) at screening, as determined by the central laboratory
3. Severe liver or kidney diseases (alanine aminotransferase [ALAT] and aspartate transaminase [ASAT] levels >5 times of upper limit of normal, creatinine>120 µmol/L)
4. Patients receiving or scheduled to receive immunomodulating drugs (other than anti-retroviral chemotherapy) such as alpha-interferon, prednisone (equivalent to >10 mg/day), or similar drugs
5. Treatment with any investigational medicinal product in another interventional clinical study currently or within 4 weeks before enrollment

facility.name: Specialized Hospital for Active Treatment "Joan Pavel"
Barnaul Branch of RAMS hematology center
